meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tiny.
meanings.sent1: The tininess of the toy car made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: I marveled at the tininess of the ladybug crawling on the leaf.
meanings.sent3: The tininess of the kitten's meow was surprisingly loud in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the tininess of the squirrel seemed almost invisible.
meanings.sent5: The tininess of the seed held the promise of a mighty oak tree.

meanings.definition: The condition of being very small in size.
meanings.sent1: She was amazed by the tininess of the newborn baby's fingers.
meanings.sent2: The tininess of the pebble made it hard to spot among the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The tininess of the ant made it a formidable opponent in the bug race.
meanings.sent4: The tininess of the snowflake belied its intricate beauty.
meanings.sent5: The tininess of the pebble in her shoe caused great discomfort.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being minuscule or petite.
meanings.sent1: The tininess of the flower petals added to their delicate beauty.
meanings.sent2: I admired the tininess of the intricate jewelry she wore.
meanings.sent3: The tininess of the teacup made it perfect for tiny hands.
meanings.sent4: The tininess of the hummingbird's nest was a marvel of engineering.
meanings.sent5: The tininess of the butterfly's wings held a world of vibrant colors.
